Title: 1. People
Write-Up Text: The people are vocal about their stance on Australia's political agenda. One person warns against prioritizing one group over another in the allocation of financial support. Another argues that simplifying the process for raising welfare payments and axing tax cuts should be a no-brainer. The people's faith is tested when announcements about the delayed timing of the AFL executive chief's replacement are made. Finally the government finds increasing optimism amid their expectations for the federal budget with some asserting that it may involve the much-needed allocation of funds to a big-ticket item like the Macquarie Point stadium. Overall the people are watchful and critical of politicians and their policies.
